page.title: 15A YEAR ON GLENMOOR FARM
page.content: A herd of 60 dairy cows with approx. 60 young cattle,together with 3000 laying hens and 500 young birds, make winter a constantly busy time. During the winter we try to get most of the land ploughed and a great deal of manure is spread wherever possible. Potatoes are sorted, bagged and sold from October to February. Up to early August most of the cattle are still indoors. Outside in the Spring, approximately 40 acres of spring corn is sown, as are potatoes and turnips for cattle feeding. Fencing is always a problem and all has to be secure before the cattle are turned out to grass. We begin cutting grass for silage in early June and grass for hay in late June.
